TEXT: The applicant is a NORP national , born in DATE and living in GPE . He is represented before the Court by Mr Tyge Trier , a lawyer practising in GPE .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the applicant , may be summarised as follows .

By indictment of CARDINAL DATE the applicant was charged with malicious damage in that , while walking on a road along with CARDINAL other young men on their way to a discotheque an evening in DATE , he had knocked his fist against the front window of an oncoming slow driving car with the result that the window cracked .

At the first court session , held on DATE , the applicant was heard . Furthermore , the driver testified that she had seen the applicant very close up when the incident happened and therefore was able to identify him shortly afterwards at the discotheque and again in court . The applicant requested an adjournment of the trial in order to hear witnesses on his behalf , more specifically CARDINAL of the above CARDINAL men , henceforth called ORG and ORG . In the following court session ORG testified that he had not seen any window crack and he could not remember if any of the men had discussed later who might have cracked it . The witnesses CJ and CE did not appear . It appears that ORG was not called and the applicant withdrew his request to hear CE . At the prosecution ’s request a police officer who was present in the discotheque on TIME when the driver had identified the applicant finally testified .

By judgment of CARDINAL DATE ORG Sj.(retten i PERSON . ) found the applicant guilty of the charges brought against him following an evaluation of the available evidence and sentenced him to pay a fine of MONEY ( DKK ) .

On DATE the Leave to Appeal Board ( Procesbevillingsnævnet ) received an application from the applicant for leave to appeal , co - signed by ORG , in which the applicant declared that ORG was the perpetrator .

Consequently , ORG was provisionally charged with the offence and questioned by the police on CARDINAL and DATE . According to the police reports ORG stated that he could not remember any car or any cracked window , but the applicant had told him that he ( CE ) was the perpetrator . He refused to elaborate on the exact time when the applicant had told him so . According to a police report of DATE , ORG told the police on the phone that he did not have time to read his previous statements and he did not care either . However , after the last interview he remembered , although he had been very drunk , that he did stretch his arm and thereby hit the car , but he could still not remember that the window cracked .
The applicant was granted leave to appeal to ORG of Eastern GPE ( PERSON ) on DATE .

On DATE the applicant ’s appeal was scheduled to take place on CARDINAL DATE , and on DATE a summons was served on CE to appear as a witness . On DATE the applicant informed ORG that CE was going to work in GPE for DATE as from DATE , and therefore he requested an adjournment of the trial . A copy of ORG ’s work contract was enclosed . ORG , however , proceeded with the trial as scheduled . The driver and a police officer gave testimony . As for the driver she confirmed her identification of the applicant as the perpetrator once more . As to the witnesses on the applicant ’s behalf ORG did not appear , since he was detained on remand in another case . Accordingly his statement during ORG trial was read out during the ORG trial . As for ORG his statements given to the Police on DATE , DATE and DATE were read out during the trial . Having regard to the available evidence , including the above statements submitted by ORG , ORG did not find an adjournment necessary as requested by the applicant in order to hear CE in person . On DATE ORG upheld ORG judgment on the basis of the evidence as set out above .
The applicant ’s request for leave to appeal to ORG ( Højesteret ) was refused by the Leave to Appeal Board on DATE .
